intro: Hitoa, commonly known as the "ghost flower," is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, translucent petals that appear to shimmer in the sunlight, giving it its ethereal appearance. The plant has a unique growth habit, often growing in dense clusters along rocky outcrops and forest floors.
